newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 31.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 31.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Thursday:
** Indonesia would keep the rupiah at reasonable levels against the dollar in a bid to maintain monetary stability, Finance Minister Mar'ie Muhammad said.

** The Dow Jones industrial average ended 13.79 points lower at 5,993.23 on Wednesday after government data indicating slower economic growth was offset by another report showing a smaller-than-expected decline in sales of new homes.
** The Jakarta Composite Index rose 1.11 points, or 0.20 percent, to close at 568.86 points on Wednesday.
** On Thursday, the Indonesian rupiah was at 2,328.10/28.50 in early trading against an opening of 2,328.00/28.50.
** Plantation firm London Sumatra on announcement of a rise in its 1996 nine month net profit compared with the same period last year.
** Cement counter Semen Gresik on its announcement of nine-month profits of 193.98 billion rupiah, more than double the figure for the year-ago period.
** Astra on reports that PT Nusamba which bought a large Astra stake recently, was unlikely to lobby for any changes in the management.
** Textile firm Pan Brothers Tex on reports of a plan to divest stakes in privately-owned firms PT Pancaplaza Indotextile, PT Charpan Buana and PT Pancaprima Ekabrothers.
** Property firm Suryamas Duta Makmur on market talk of a possible rights issue.
** Secondliner Intraco Penta on reports of a stock split to 500 rupiah from the previous 1,000 rupiah.
